The judge must provide findings regarding the applicable sentencing guidelines, the hypothetical sentence without the statutory minimum, the demographics of the victim and defendant, and the reason for prosecuting in Federal court for cases involving life imprisonment under the Two Strikes and You're Out Child Protection Act. The Government attorney must provide cost data to assist the court in making findings required for sentencing in Federal court cases involving life imprisonment. The court is not bound by the information provided and the findings must be reported annually to Congress by the Administrative Office of the United States Courts. SEC. 4. CONFORMING AMENDMENT. Sections 2247 and 2426 of title 18, United States Code, are each amended by inserting ``, unless section 3559(e) applies'' before the final period. Passed the House of Representatives March 14, 2002.
